# nbdev_cards_q


<!-- WARNING: THIS FILE WAS AUTOGENERATED! DO NOT EDIT! -->

A deck of cards demo of [nbdev](https://nbdev.fast.ai) based on idea
from[Think Python 2nd
Edition](https://greenteapress.com/wp/think-python-2e/) by Allen B.
Downey.

This file will become your README and also the index of your
documentation.

## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install nbdev_cards_q in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure nbdev_cards_q package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to nbdev_cards_q
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/QinJiojio/nbdev_cards_q):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/QinJiojio/nbdev_cards_q.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/QinJiojio/nbdev_cards_q)

``` sh
$ conda install -c QinJiojio nbdev_cards_q
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/nbdev_cards_q/)

``` sh
$ pip install nbdev_cards_q
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/QinJiojio/nbdev_cards_q)’s
[pages](https://QinJiojio.github.io/nbdev_cards_q/). Additionally you
can find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/QinJiojio/nbdev_cards_q) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/nbdev_cards_q/) respectively.

## How to use

This lib provides a ‘card’ class you can use to creat, display, and
compare playing cards:

``` python
Card(1,3)
```

    3♦

``` python
suits
```

    ['♣', '♦', '♥', '♠']
